results.title: Igor and the dancing stallions (Yugoslavia)
results.creator_credit: Fred Harris, Peter Rowe, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Focuses on sixteen-year-old boy Igor Lang who for two years has been a stableboy on the famed Lipica horse farm in Yugoslavia, training his mount, Maestozo, in the graceful steps of dressage. When Maestozo suffers a leg injury due to Igor’s handling, the boy loses hope of participating in an upcoming celebration. But good care heals the wound and Igor and Maestozo play their part in the program that marks the farm’s 400th anniversary. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: If***
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Memorial, Michael Medwin and Lindsay Anderson
results.brief_description: This film captures the particular ethos of a public school and the general flavour of any highly structured community, combining an allegorical thrust with a clear-eyed exploration of an essentially British institution. Constructed in 8 chapters introduced by titles in a Brechtian schema, a surrealistic edge (Anderson prefers ‘heightened reality’) is brought to events in the later sections as the line is blurred between fantasy and reality, an approach reflecting the influence of Zero de Conduite. Although conceived several years earlier, the timing of “If’s” release coinciding with the events of May 1968 ensured its success against the expectations of Paramount’s executives.

results.title: If you want a girl like me
results.creator_credit: Susan Huycke, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film looks at questions surrounding life-prolonging treatment for disabled newborns. When a teenage girl discovers that her newborn baby suffers from spina bifida and hydrocephalus, she refuses to agree to a life-saving shunt. While her boyfriend, the father, tries to convince her to accept responsibility for the infant, the hospital awaits their signed consent to proceed with the operation.
results.title_for_label: If you want a girl like me
results.creator_credit_for_label: Susan Huycke, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: If you love this planet
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Edward Le Lorrain, Kathleen Shannon and Terri Nash
results.brief_description: This film records a lecture given to students by outspoken nuclear critic, Dr. Helen Caldicott, president of Physicians for Social Responsibility in the United States. Her message is clear: disarmament cannot be postponed. Archival film footage of the bombing of Hiroshima and images of its survivors seven months after the attack heighten the urgency of her message: namely, that unless we shake off our indifference and work to prevent nuclear war, we stand a slim chance of surviving the 20th century.

results.title: If you know how I feel: Scott's old new friend
results.creator_credit: Centron Educational Films and Linda Haskins
results.brief_description: Tells the story of 10-year-old Scott who befriends an old woman in a park. The value of their friendship is revealed as Scott obtains books for the woman and she helps him to improve his reading. A sympathetic portrayal of old age that will help in breaking down stereotypes and promoting discussion about values and self-determination. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
